intro: Daviesia incrassata var. typica, commonly known as the broad-leaved daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and sclerophyllous forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance. Daviesia incrassata var. typica is also important in local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
